cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.CC, cs.CE, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with information theoretic aspects of perfect secrecy systems, which are typically studied in the information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR) communities. The paper also discusses the tradeoff between key consumption and number of channel uses, which is a topic of interest in coding theory (cs.CC) and communication theory (cs.CE). Finally, the paper introduces a new parameter called effective key consumption, which is a measure of the efficiency of the system, and could be of interest to researchers in the field of systems and information (cs.SI).
